trans-unit.source: For low-dpi devices, the unit px represents the physical reference pixel; other units are defined relative to it. Thus, 1in is defined as 96px, which equals 72pt. The consequence of this definition is that on such devices, dimensions described in inches (in), centimeters (cm), or millimeters (mm) doesn't necessary match the size of the physical unit with the same name.
trans-unit.target: 对于低dpi的设备，单位 px 代表物理参考像素；相对于它定义了其他单位。因此， 1in 定义为 96px ，等于 72pt 。此定义的结果是，在此类设备上，以英寸（ in ），厘米（ cm ）或毫米（ mm ）为单位描述的尺寸不一定与具有相同名称的物理单元的尺寸相匹配。

trans-unit.source: For low-dpi devices, the unit px represents the physical reference pixel; other units are defined relative to it. Thus, 1in is defined as 96px, which equals 72pt. The consequence of this definition is that on such devices, dimensions described in inches (in), centimeters (cm), or millimeters (mm) don't necessary match the size of the physical unit with the same name.

trans-unit.source: Formally, the display property sets an element's inner and outer display types. The outer type sets an element's participation in flow layout; the inner type sets the layout of children. Some values of display are fully defined in their own individual specifications; for example the detail of what happens when display: flex is declared is defined in the CSS Flexible Box Model specification. See the table at the end of this document for all of the individual specifications.

trans-unit.source: Fragmentation occurs when an inline box wraps onto multiple lines. It also occurs when a block spans more than one column inside a column layout container, or spans a page break when printed. Each piece of the rendering for the element is called a fragment.

From CSS Level 2 (Revision 1)
The definition of 'text-transform' in that specification., extends letters to any Unicode character in the Number or Letter general category. Modifies the behavior of capitalize to apply to the first letter of the word, ignoring initial punctuations or symbols. Adds the full-width and full-size-kana keywords.

From CSS Level 2 (Revision 1)
The definition of 'text-transform' in that specification., extends letters to any Unicode character in the Number or Letter general category. Modifies the behavior of capitalize to apply to the first letter of the word, ignoring initial punctuations or symbols. Adds the full-width keyword to mix smoothly ideographic characters and alphabetical characters.

trans-unit.source: From Firefox 10 to Firefox 16 (inclusive), the isolate keyword could be used together with bidi-override, which was the syntax from a previous version of the specification. From Firefox 17, only one value is allowed. Use isolate-override instead the previous isolate bidi-override.
trans-unit.target: 从Firefox 10到Firefox 16（包括Firefox）， isolate 关键字可以与 bidi-override 结合使用，bidi-override是该规范先前版本的语法。在Firefox 17中，仅允许使用一个值。使用 isolate-override 代替以前的 isolate bidi-override 。

trans-unit.source: From Firefox 10, the default color space when handling masks is sRGB. Previously, the default and only supported color space was linear RGB. This changes the appearance of mask effects, but brings Firefox into compliance with the second edition of the SVG 1.1 specification.
trans-unit.target: 从Firefox 10开始,处理遮罩时的默认色彩空间是sRGB。此前,默认且唯一支持的色彩空间是线性RGB。这改变了遮罩效果的外观,但使Firefox符合第二版SVG 1.1规范。

trans-unit.source: From Firefox 29 until Firefox 31, this feature was implemented by the var-variablename syntax.
trans-unit.target: 从Firefox 29到Firefox 31，此功能由 var-variablename 语法实现。

trans-unit.source: From Firefox 4, the blur radius is capped at 300 for performance reasons.

trans-unit.source: From the specification we know that we need to ensure our document maintains the logical order of our content. How should we approach our development to make sure that we maintain accessibility for the different users and the ways that they interact with our pages?
trans-unit.target: 从规范中我们知道,我们需要确保我们的文档保持内容的逻辑顺序。我们应该如何进行开发,以确保我们为不同的用户以及他们与我们的页面互动的方式保持无障碍性?

trans-unit.source: From version 3 to 4.3, there is a serious bug where text-rendering: optimizeLegibility causes custom web fonts to not render. This was fixed in version 4.4.
trans-unit.target: 从版本3到4.3，存在一个严重的 text-rendering: optimizeLegibility 错误：optimizeLegibility导致自定义Web字体无法渲染。在版本4.4中已修复此问题。

trans-unit.source: From version 4 to 6, Internet Explorer enlarges an element with overflow: visible (default value) to fit the content inside it. height and width behave like min-height and min-width, respectively.
trans-unit.target: 从版本4到版本6，Internet Explorer会放大一个带有 overflow: visible 的元素：可见（默认值）以适合其中的内容。 height 和 width 的行为分别类似于 min-height 和 min-width 。

trans-unit.source: Gecko allowed none as a value of the system and fallback descriptors of @counter-style, which as per spec should result in an invalid at-rule. Firefox's new parallel CSS engine (also known as Quantum CSS or Stylo, released in Firefox 57) fixed this (bug 1377414).
trans-unit.target: Gecko不允许 none 值作为 system 的值，并且 @counter-style fallback 描述符不符合规范，这将导致无效规则。 Firefox的新并行CSS引擎（也称为Quantum CSS或Stylo，在Firefox 57中发布）修复了此问题（错误1377414）。

trans-unit.source: Gecko defaults
trans-unit.target: Gecko默认

trans-unit.source: Gecko has a bug meaning that background-position can't be transitioned between two values containing different numbers of <position> values, for example background-position: 10px 10px; and background-position: 20px 20px, 30px 30px; (see bug 1390446). Firefox's new parallel CSS engine (also known as Quantum CSS or Stylo, planned for release in Firefox 57) fixes this.
trans-unit.target: Gecko有一个错误，意味着 background-position 不能在包含不同数量 <position> 值的两个值之间 transitioned ，例如 background-position: 10px 10px; 和 background-position: 20px 20px, 30px 30px; （请参见错误1390446）。 Firefox的新并行CSS引擎（也称为Quantum CSS或Stylo，计划在Firefox 57中发布）修复了此问题。

trans-unit.source: Gecko has a bug whereby transitions will not work when transitioning from a text-shadow with a color specified to a text-shadow without a color specified (bug 726550). This has been fixed in Firefox's new parallel CSS engine (also known as Quantum CSS or Stylo, planned for release in Firefox 57).
trans-unit.target: 壁虎具有由此一个错误 transition 旨意不工作从过渡时 text-shadow 与指定的彩色 text-shadow 没有颜色指定（错误726550）。Firefox的新并行CSS引擎（也称为Quantum CSS或Stylo，计划在Firefox 57中发布）已解决此问题。

trans-unit.source: Gecko has a bug whereby when you animate an offscreen element onscreen but specify a delay, Gecko does not repaint on some platforms, e.g. Windows (bug 1383239). This has been fixed in Firefox's new parallel CSS engine (also known as Quantum CSS or Stylo, planned for release in Firefox 57).
trans-unit.target: Gecko有一个错误，当您在屏幕上为屏幕外元素设置动画但指定延迟时，Gecko不会在某些平台上重绘，例如Windows（错误1383239）。Firefox的新并行CSS引擎（也称为Quantum CSS或Stylo，计划在Firefox 57中发布）已解决此问题。

trans-unit.source: Gecko used to have a long-standing bug whereby radial gradients like radial-gradient(circle gold,red) would work, even though they shouldn't because of the missing comma between circle and gold. Also, calc() expressions were rejected — causing the value to be invalid — when used as the radius component of a radial-gradient() function (bug 1376019). Firefox's new parallel CSS engine (also known as Quantum CSS or Stylo, released in Firefox 57) fixed these bugs.
trans-unit.target: Gecko曾经有一个长期存在的错误，即使由于 circle 和 gold 之间缺少逗号而不应该这样做，如 radial-gradient(circle gold,red) 也可以工作。同样，当用作 radial-gradient() 函数的半径分量时， calc() 表达式也被拒绝-导致该值无效（错误1376019）。 Firefox的新并行CSS引擎（也称为Quantum CSS或Stylo，在Firefox 57中发布）修复了这些错误。

Generally, when you write the above media query, the styles are applied if the viewport, generally the browser window is between 400px and 500px, inclusive. The width media query in the SVG is based on the element in which the SVG is contained — the <img> if the source is an SVG file, the SVG itself if the SVG is included directly into the HTML, or the parent if the parent element has a width assigned and — not the viewport’s width. With the above media query being in our SVG file, the CSS is applied if the SVG container is between 400 and 500px.
trans-unit.target: 通常，当您编写上述媒体查询时，如果视口（通常是浏览器窗口）在400px至500px（含）之间，则会应用样式。SVG中的宽度媒体查询基于包含SVG的元素-如果<img>如果源是SVG文件，则为<img>；如果SVG直接包含在HTML中，则为SVG本身；如果是父级，则为父级元素具有指定的宽度，而不是视口的宽度。在我们的SVG文件中包含上述媒体查询后，如果SVG容器在400至500px之间，则会应用CSS。

trans-unit.source: Given that interoperable support for display: contents is limited and we do not yet have subgrids, there is a definite temptation when developing a site using CSS Grid Layout to flatten out the markup, to remove semantic elements in order to make it simpler to create a layout. An example would be where some content was semantically marked up as a list but you decide to use a set of <div> elements instead as then you can have the element to be a direct child of a container set to display: grid. Be aware of this temptation and find ways to develop your design without stripping out the markup. Starting out with a well-structured document is a very good way to avoid the problem, as you will be aware that you are removing semantic elements in order to make the layout work if you actually have to go into the document and do so!
trans-unit.target: 鉴于对 display: contents 可互操作性支持有限，并且我们还没有子网格，因此在使用CSS Grid Layout展平标记，删除语义元素以使其创建起来更简单的网站开发站点时，存在一定的诱惑。布局。一个示例是将某些内容在语义上标记为列表，但您决定使用一组 <div> 元素代替，因为这样您就可以将该元素设置为要 display: grid 的容器的直接子代：grid。请注意这种诱惑，并找到开发设计而不删除标记的方法。从结构良好的文档开始是避免该问题的一种很好的方法，因为您将意识到，如果实际上必须进入文档，您将删除语义元素以使布局正常工作！

trans-unit.source: Given that interoperable support for subgrid is limited, there is a definite temptation when developing a site using CSS Grid Layout to flatten out the markup, to remove semantic elements in order to make it simpler to create a layout. An example would be where some content was semantically marked up as a list but you decide to use a set of <div> elements instead as then you can have the element to be a direct child of a container set to display: grid. Be aware of this temptation and find ways to develop your design without stripping out the markup. Starting out with a well-structured document is a very good way to avoid the problem, as you will be aware that you are removing semantic elements in order to make the layout work if you actually have to go into the document and do so!

Given that these features take a bit of work to discover and use, it may seem a fair question to ask why one would bother to use them. The answer lies in the specific features that will make a site more useful, readable, and polished:

trans-unit.source: Given that we have this ability to position create lines from named areas and areas from named lines it is worth taking a little bit of time to plan your naming strategy when starting out creating your grid layout. By selecting names that will make sense to you and your team you will help everyone to use the layouts you create more easily.
trans-unit.target: 鉴于我们有这种能力来定位从命名的区域创建线条和从命名的线条创建区域,当开始创建网格布局时,值得花一点时间来计划你的命名策略。通过选择对您和您的团队有意义的名称,您将帮助每个人更容易地使用您创建的布局。

trans-unit.source: Grade may become one of the more common custom axes as it has a known history in typeface design. The practice of designing different grades of a typeface was often done in reaction to intended use and printing technique. The term 'grade' refers to the relative weight or density of the typeface design, but differs from traditional 'weight' in that the physical space the text occupies does not change, so changing the text grade doesn't change the overall layout of the text or elements around it. This makes grade a useful axis of variation as it can be varied or animated without causing reflow of the text itself.
trans-unit.target: 等级可能会成为更常见的定制轴之一,因为它在字体设计中有着众所周知的历史。设计不同等级的字体的做法通常是根据预期的用途和印刷技术来进行的。术语 "等级 "指的是字体设计的相对重量或密度,但与传统的 "重量 "不同的是,文字所占的物理空间不会改变,因此改变文字等级不会改变文字或其周围元素的整体布局。这使得等级成为一个有用的变化轴,因为它可以被改变或动画化,而不会导致文本本身的回流。

trans-unit.source: Gradients are limited to background-image, border-image, and mask-image.

trans-unit.source: Gradients can be used anywhere you would use an <image>, such as in backgrounds. Because gradients are dynamically generated, they can negate the need for the raster image files that traditionally were used to achieve similar effects. In addition, because gradients are generated by the browser, they look better than raster images when zoomed in, and can be resized on the fly.
trans-unit.target: 可以在使用 <image> 的任何地方（例如在背景中）使用渐变。由于渐变是动态生成的，因此可以消除对传统上用来实现类似效果的栅格图像文件的需求。另外，由于渐变是由浏览器生成的，因此放大时它们看起来比栅格图像更好，并且可以即时调整大小。

trans-unit.source: Gradients support transparency, so you can stack multiple backgrounds to achieve some pretty fancy effects. The backgrounds are stacked from top to bottom, with the first specified being on top.
trans-unit.target: Gradients支持透明,所以你可以堆叠多个背景来实现一些漂亮的花哨效果。背景从上到下叠加,第一个指定的背景在上面。

trans-unit.source: Grid contains alignment features so that we can control how the items align once placed into a grid area, and how the entire grid is aligned.
trans-unit.target: 网格包含了对齐功能,这样我们就可以控制物品放入网格区域后如何对齐,以及整个网格如何对齐。

trans-unit.source: Grid gap shorthands
trans-unit.target: 网格间隙速记

trans-unit.source: Grid has a solution for this with the minmax() function. In this next example I am using minmax() in the value of grid-auto-rows. This means automatically created rows will be a minimum of 100 pixels tall, and a maximum of auto. Using auto means that the size will look at the content size and will stretch to give space for the tallest item in a cell, in this row.
trans-unit.target: Grid使用 minmax() 函数为此提供了一个解决方案。在下一个示例中，我在 grid-auto-rows 的值中使用 minmax() 。这意味着自动创建的行的最小高度为100像素，最大为 auto 。使用 auto 表示该尺寸将查看内容的尺寸，并会拉伸以为该行中单元格中最高的项目提供空间。

trans-unit.source: Grid interacts with absolutely positioned elements, which can be useful if you want to position an item inside a grid or grid area. The specification defines the behavior when a grid container is a containing block and a parent of the absolutely positioned item.
trans-unit.target: 网格与绝对定位的元素交互,如果你想在网格或网格区域内定位一个项目,这很有用。该规范定义了当一个网格容器是包含块和绝对定位项的父块时的行为。

trans-unit.source: Grid is a powerful specification and when combined with other parts of CSS such as flexbox, can help you to create layouts that were previously impossible to build in CSS. It all starts by creating a grid in your grid container.
trans-unit.target: Grid是一个功能强大的规范，当与CSS的其他部分（例如flexbox）结合使用时，可以帮助您创建以前无法在CSS中构建的布局。这一切都始于在网格容器中创建网格。

trans-unit.source: Grid is a powerful specification that, when combined with other parts of CSS such as flexbox, can help you create layouts that were previously impossible to build in CSS. It all starts by creating a grid in your grid container.
Grid items can occupy the same cell. If we return to our example with items positioned by line number, we can change this to make two items overlap.
trans-unit.target: 网格项可以占据同一个单元格。如果我们回到按行号定位的项目的例子,我们可以改变这一点,使两个项目重叠。

trans-unit.source: Grid layout
trans-unit.target: 网格布局

trans-unit.source: Grid layout gives authors great powers of rearrangement over the document. However, these are not a substitute for correct ordering of the document source. The order property and grid placement do not affect ordering in non-visual media (such as speech). Likewise, rearranging grid items visually does not affect the default traversal order of sequential navigation modes (such as cycling through links, see e.g. tabindex HTML5).
trans-unit.target: 网格布局使作者可以对文档进行重新排列。但是，这些并不能代替文档源的正确排序。订单属性和网格放置不会影响非可视媒体（例如语音）中的订单。同样，在视觉上重新排列网格项不会影响顺序导航模式的默认遍历顺序（例如，通过链接循环，请参见例如tabindex HTML5）。

trans-unit.source: Grid lines
trans-unit.target: 网线

trans-unit.source: Grid places items that have not been given a grid position in what is described in the specification as “order modified document order”. This means that if you have used the order property at all, the items will be placed by that order, not their DOM order. Otherwise they will stay by default in the order that they are entered in the document source.
trans-unit.target: 网格将未赋予网格位置的项目放置在规范中称为“订单修改文档订单”的位置。这意味着，如果您完全使用了 order 属性，则将按该顺序放置商品，而不是按其DOM顺序放置商品。否则，默认情况下，它们将按照在文档源中输入的顺序保留。

trans-unit.source: Grid prefixes are disabled by default because some properties can’t be prefixed.
trans-unit.target: 默认情况下，网格前缀是禁用的，因为某些属性无法添加前缀。

trans-unit.source: Grid row
trans-unit.target: 网格行

trans-unit.source: Grid template areas
trans-unit.target: 网格模板区域

trans-unit.source: Grid works from the layout in. When you use CSS Grid Layout you create a layout and then you place items into it, or you allow the auto-placement rules to place the items into the grid cells according to that strict grid. It is possible to create tracks that respond to the size of the content, however, they will also change the entire track.
trans-unit.target: Grid的工作原理是从布局中。当你使用CSS Grid Layout时,你创建了一个布局,然后你将项目放入其中,或者你允许自动放置规则根据该严格的网格将项目放入网格单元中。可以创建响应内容大小的轨道,然而,它们也会改变整个轨道。

trans-unit.source: Grouped elements that permit multiple selections may also have multiple defaults, i.e., they may have multiple items initially selected. In this case, all defaults are represented using the :default pseudo-class. For example, you can style the default checkboxes among a group of checkboxes.
trans-unit.target: 允许多个选择的分组元素也可能具有多个默认值，即，它们可能具有多个最初选择的项目。在这种情况下，所有默认值都使用 :default 伪类表示。例如，您可以在一组复选框中设置默认复选框的样式。

trans-unit.source: HTML spec also says that an <input> element can be replaced, because <input> elements of the "image" type are replaced elements similar to <img>. However, other form controls, including other types of <input> elements, are explicitly listed as non-replaced elements (the spec describes their default platform-specific rendering with the term "Widgets").
trans-unit.target: HTML规范还指出，一个 <input> 元件可以被替换，因为 <input> 的元素 "image" 类型被替换类似的元件 <img> 。但是，其他形式的控件（包括其他类型的 <input> 元素）被明确列出为不可替换的元素（规范使用术语“小部件”描述了其默认的特定于平台的呈现）。

trans-unit.source: Having defined these names I then create my layout. This time, instead of placing my items using line numbers specified on the items themselves, I create the whole layout on the grid container.
trans-unit.target: 定义了这些名称之后,我就创建我的布局。这一次,我没有使用项目本身指定的行号来放置我的项目,而是在网格容器上创建整个布局。

trans-unit.source: Having done this, grid will now backfill the gaps, as it moves through the grid it leaves gaps as before, but then if it finds an item that will fit in a previous gap it will pick it up and take it out of DOM order to place it in the gap. As with any other reordering in grid this does not change the logical order. Tab order for example, will still follow the document order. We will take a look at the potential accessibility issues of Grid Layout in a later guide, but you should take care when creating this disconnect between the visual order and display order.
trans-unit.target: 当它在网格中移动时,它会像以前一样留下空隙,但是如果它发现一个项目可以放入以前的空隙中,它就会把它从DOM顺序中拿出来放到空隙中。就像在网格中的任何其他重新排序一样,这不会改变逻辑顺序。例如,Tab顺序仍然会遵循文档顺序。我们将在后面的指南中看看网格布局的潜在可访问性问题,但你在创建这种视觉顺序和显示顺序之间的脱节时应该小心。

trans-unit.source: Having looked at various ways of placing items on our grids and many of the properties used to define grid, this is a good time to take a look at a couple of shorthands that are available for defining the grid and many things about it all in one line of CSS.
trans-unit.target: 看过了在我们的网格上放置项目的各种方法和许多用于定义网格的属性,现在是一个很好的时间来看看几个可用于定义网格的速记,以及许多关于它的事情都在一行CSS中。

trans-unit.source: Here the dimensions of the element are calculated as: width = border + padding + width of the content, and height = border + padding + height of the content.
trans-unit.target: 在这里，元素的尺寸计算为：width = border + padding +内容的宽度，height = border + padding + content的高度。

trans-unit.source: Here we are saying that the size of the item for the purposes of our space distribution calculation is 0 — all the space is up for grabs and as all of the items have the same flex-grow factor, they each get an equal amount of space distributed. The end result is three equal width, flexible items.
trans-unit.target: 在这里，我们要说的是，出于空间分配计算的目的，项目的大小为 0 -所有空间都可以争夺，并且所有项目都具有相同的 flex-grow 因子，因此每个项目都获得了相等的空间分散式。最终结果是三个相等宽度的柔性物品。

trans-unit.source: Here we are using the auto margins technique described in Using auto margins for main axis alignment. The items are aligned on the main axis with flex-start as this is the initial behaviour of flexbox, and we are aligning the item on the right by giving it a left margin of auto. You can move the class from one item to another to change where the split happens.
trans-unit.target: 在这里，我们使用了将自动边距用于主轴对齐中所述的自动边距技术。使用 flex-start 将项目在主轴上对齐，因为这是flexbox的初始行为，我们通过为项目赋予左侧的auto边距来将其在右侧对齐。您可以将班级从一项移至另一项，以更改拆分发生的位置。

trans-unit.source: Here we see HTML that includes two <img> elements, each displaying the MDN logo.
trans-unit.target: 在这里，我们看到包含两个 <img> 元素的HTML ，每个元素都显示MDN徽标。

trans-unit.source: Here we've set the image src to a data URI containing a simple SVG image; the <rect> inside has been made to take its fill and stroke values from the fill and stroke set on the <img> element by giving them the context-fill/context-stroke keywords in their values, along with a fallback color for the fill (red) which will be used in the case that the SVG is loaded standalone in a top-level window (where it will have no context element to provide context values). Note that if a color is set directly on the SVG, but then the context color is also specified, the context color overrides the direct color.
trans-unit.target: 在这里，我们将图像 src 设置为包含简单SVG图像的数据URI；通过将 <rect> 内部的值设置为 context-fill / context-stroke 关键字，并为其提供后备颜色，可以使内部的<rect>从 <img> 元素上的 fill 和 stroke 设置中获取其 fill 和 stroke 值。填充（红色），用于在顶层窗口中独立加载SVG的情况下使用（该窗口将没有上下文元素来提供上下文值）。请注意，如果直接在SVG上设置颜色，但同时又指定了上下文颜色，则上下文颜色将覆盖直接颜色。

trans-unit.source: Here you can see the results in action. Note also the effect of scrolling the example horizontally upon the values returned and how the value of clientX doesn't change.
trans-unit.target: 在这里，您可以看到实际的结果。当您在蓝色框内或周围移动鼠标时，请注意在各种坐标系中鼠标X和Y坐标值的变化，您可以从中获得这些值。还要注意在返回的值上水平滚动示例的效果以及 clientX 的值如何保持不变。

trans-unit.source: Here, the form itself, along with the margin, border, and padding, will be 100% of it's parent's width. We declare the input and label to be the lesser of 40% of the form width up to the padding or 400px wide, whichever is smaller. In other words, the widest, or max-width, the label and input will be is 400px. The narrowest they will be is 40% of the form's width, which on a watch is going to be very small.
trans-unit.target: 在这里,表单本身,以及margin、border和padding,将是它的父级宽度的100%,我们声明输入和标签是表单宽度的40%到padding或400px宽,以较小的为准。我们声明输入和标签的宽度为表单宽度的40%,直至padding,或400px宽,以较小者为准。换句话说,标签和输入的最大宽度是400px。它们最窄的宽度是表单宽度的40%,这在手表上是非常小的。

trans-unit.source: Here, the form itself, along with the margin, border, and padding, will be 100% of its parent's width. trans-unit.source: However, for some properties (those where percentages are relative to something that may require layout to determine, such as width, margin-right, text-indent, and top), percentage-specified values turn into percentage-computed values. Additionally, unitless numbers specified on the line-height property become the computed value, as specified. The relative values that remain in the computed value become absolute when the used value is determined.
trans-unit.target: 但是，对于某些属性（那些百分比相对于可能需要布局确定的东西而言，例如 width ， margin-right ， text-indent 和 top ），指定百分比的值将转换为百分比计算的值。此外，在 line-height 属性上指定的无单位数字将成为指定的计算值。当保留在所计算的值的相对值成为绝对用过的值被确定。

However, in older browsers like IE8-9 that do not support Flexible Box Layout, these are not available. In order to center an element inside its parent, use margin: 0 auto;.
trans-unit.target: 但是，在不支持“灵活框式布局”的较旧的浏览器（如IE8-9）中，这些功能不可用。为了使元素在其父元素内部居中，请使用 margin: 0 auto; 。

trans-unit.source: However, in some situations it is also useful to set the maximum height of the columns explicitly, and then lay out content starting at the first column and creating as many columns as necessary, possibly overflowing to the right. Therefore, if the height is constrained, by setting the CSS height or max-height properties on a multi-column block, each column is allowed to grow to that height and no further before adding new column. This mode is also much more efficient for layout.
trans-unit.target: 但是，在某些情况下，显式设置列的最大高度，然后对内容进行布局也很有用，该内容从第一列开始，并根据需要创建尽可能多的列，可能会向右溢出。因此，如果高度受到限制，则通过在多列块上设置CSS height 或 max-height 属性，允许每一列增长到该高度，并且在添加新列之前不能再增长。此模式的布局效率也更高。

However, the inner display type might be something like grid or flex, in which case the direct children will display as a grid, or flex items. In such a case the element is described as creating a grid or flex formatting context. In many ways this is similar to a block formatting context, however, the children behave as flex or grid items rather than items in normal flow.

However, there are browsers that don't support feature queries but also have no support for a feature we want to use. For example, we might want to use CSS Grid, which is not supported in IE11. We can't create a fallback by checking for browsers which do not have support, as IE11 doesn't support feature queries either! In practice however, when using feature queries for progressive enhancement, this doesn't matter. You do however need to structure your CSS in a certain way, writing CSS for non-supporting browsers and overwriting it with the CSS inside the feature query.
However, this doesn't always have to be the case: you maybe have a good reason for limiting the scope of your custom properties.

trans-unit.source: I am going to create this layout using the named template areas that we learned about in the guide Grid template areas.
trans-unit.target: 我将使用在网格模板区域指南中了解的命名模板区域来创建此布局。

trans-unit.source: I can add to our earlier example by adding the grid-template-columns property, then defining the size of the column tracks.

trans-unit.source: I can cause a grid to backfill those gaps by setting grid-auto-flow: dense on the grid container. Take care when doing this however as it does take items away from their logical source order. You should only do this if your items do not have a set order – and be aware of the issues of the tab order following the source and not your reordered display.
trans-unit.target: 我可以通过在网格容器上设置 grid-auto-flow : dense 来使网格回填这些间隙。但是，在执行此操作时要小心，因为它确实会使项目脱离其逻辑源顺序。仅当您的商品没有固定顺序时才应这样做–并且要注意源后面的制表符顺序问题，而不是重新排序的显示。

trans-unit.source: I can now add a final breakpoint to move to a three-column layout.
trans-unit.target: 我现在可以添加最后一个断点,转为三栏布局。

trans-unit.source: I can then place these on the grid using the named lines, and also the span keyword.
trans-unit.target: 然后,我可以使用命名行,也可以使用跨度关键字将这些放在网格上。

trans-unit.source: I can then set up our grid, as for the example 12-column layout above.
trans-unit.target: 然后,我可以设置我们的网格,就像上面的12列布局的例子一样。

trans-unit.source: I can then tidy up the internals of the boxes using a little touch of flexbox. I set the list item to display: flex and the flex-direction to column. I can then use an auto margin on the .cta to push this bar down to the bottom of the box.
trans-unit.target: 然后，我可以使用一点点的flexbox整理盒子的内部结构。我将列表项设置为 display: flex 并将 flex-direction 设置为 column 。然后，我可以在 .cta 上使用自动边距将其向下推到框的底部。

trans-unit.source: I can use shape-margin to move the text away from the shape, giving a margin around the created shape and the text.
trans-unit.target: 我可以使用 shape-margin 将文本移离形状，在创建的形状和文本周围留出边距。

trans-unit.source: I could then place this on my grid layout framework like this.
trans-unit.target: 然后,我可以把这个放在我的网格布局框架上,像这样。

trans-unit.source: I have also set the flex-wrap property to wrap, so that if the space in the container becomes too narrow to maintain the flex basis, items will wrap onto a new row.
trans-unit.target: 我还将 flex-wrap 属性设置为 wrap ，因此，如果容器中的空间变得太窄而无法维持flex基础，则项目将换行到新行。

trans-unit.source: I have created this behaviour in the next live example. You can see how the stretching changes row based on the location of the collapsed item. If you add more content to the second item, it changes row once it gets long enough. That top row then only becomes as tall as a single line of text.
trans-unit.target: 我在接下来的实战示例中创建了这种行为。你可以看到拉伸如何根据折叠项的位置改变行。如果你向第二个项目添加更多内容,一旦它变得足够长,它就会改变行。那最上面的一行就会变得只有一行文字那么高。

trans-unit.source: I have given .box3 position relative and then positioned the sub-item with the offset properties. In this case, the positioning context is the grid area.

trans-unit.source: I have now created a grid with three 200-pixel-wide column tracks. The child items will be laid out on this grid one in each grid cell.
trans-unit.target: 我现在已经创建了一个有三个200像素宽的列轨的网格。子项将在这个网格上的每个网格单元中布局。

trans-unit.source: I make the .wrapper a grid container.
trans-unit.target: 我将 .wrapper 设置为网格容器。

trans-unit.source: I place .item from column line 2 to 7, and row 2 to 4. I then make this grid item into a grid, giving it column tracks that are a subgrid and defining rows as normal. As the item spans five column tracks, this means that the subgrid has five column tracks. I can then place .subitem on this grid.

I then enhance the layout using grid. I can turn my <ul> into a grid container with three column tracks. However, the width I have assigned to the list items themselves still applies, and it now makes those items a third of the width of the track:
trans-unit.target: 然后，我使用网格增强布局。我可以将 <ul> 变成具有三个列轨道的网格容器。但是，我分配给列表项本身的宽度仍然适用，现在使这些项的宽度是轨道宽度的三分之一：

trans-unit.source: I use an @supports rule to check for support of display: grid. I then do my grid code on the <ul>, set my width and min-height on the <li> to auto. I also remove the margins and negative margins, and replace the spacing with the grid-gap property. This means I don’t get a final margin on the last row of boxes. The layout now works, even if there is more content in one of the cards, than the others:
trans-unit.target: 我使用 @supports 规则检查对 display: grid 支持。然后，在 <ul> 上执行网格代码，在 <li> 上将宽度和 min-height 设置为 auto 。我还删除了边距和负边距，并用 grid-gap 属性替换了间距。这意味着我在最后一行盒子上没有最终的保证金。现在，即使其中一张卡片中的内容比其他卡片中的内容更多，该布局仍然有效：

trans-unit.source: I’m going to introduce another specification here, that I will be using in my examples: the CSS Writing Modes specification. This spec details how we can use these different writing modes in CSS, not just for the support of languages that have a different writing mode to English, but also for creative purposes. I’ll be using the writing-mode property to make changes to the writing mode applied to our grid, in order to demonstrate how the logical values work. If you want to dig into writing modes further, however, then I would recommend that you read Jen Simmons excellent article on CSS Writing Modes. This goes into more depth on that specification than we will touch upon here.
trans-unit.target: 我将在这里介绍另一个规范，该示例将在示例中使用：CSS Writing Modes规范。该规范详细说明了我们如何在CSS中使用这些不同的书写模式，不仅用于支持与英语具有不同书写模式的语言，还用于创造性目的。我将使用 writing-mode 属性更改应用于网格的书写模式，以演示逻辑值的工作方式。但是，如果您想进一步研究编写模式，那么我建议您阅读Jen Simmons关于CSS Writing Modes的优秀文章。在该规范上，这比我们在此更深入地讨论。

A dark background color may be needed for foreground text to be legible, if the image does not render.

trans-unit.source: If all of your items have the same flex-grow factor then space will be distributed evenly between all of them. If this is the situation that you want then typically you would use 1 as the value, however you could give them all a flex-grow of 88, or 100, or 1.2 if you like — it is a ratio. If the factor is the same for all, and there is positive free space in the flex container then it will be distributed equally to all.
trans-unit.target: 如果所有项目都具有相同的 flex-grow 因子，则空间将在所有项目之间平均分配。如果这是您要那么通常你会使用情况 1 的值，但是你可以给他们全部 flex-grow 的 88 ，或 100 ，或 1.2 ，如果你喜欢-这是一个比值。如果所有因素均相同，并且flex容器中有正的自由空间，则它将平均分配给所有人。

trans-unit.source: If an element contains only floated elements, its height collapses to nothing. This is called clearfix, and one way to do it is to add clear to a replaced ::afterpseudo-element on it.

trans-unit.source: If any of the three concerned values is a forced break value (always, left, right, page, column, or region), it has precedence. trans-unit.target: 如果三个相关值中的任何一个是强制中断值（ always ， left ， right ， page ， column 或 region ），则它具有优先级。如果此类中断中有多个，则采用流中最新出现的元素之一（即， break-before 值优先于 break-after 值，后者本身优先于 break-inside 价值）。

trans-unit.source: If any of the three concerned values is a forced break value (always, left, right, page, column, or region), it has precedence. trans-unit.source: If at all possible, prefer updating HTML markup over modifying content using CSS2 system color keywords. This helps keep the content more predictable.

If at any time in the design process you find yourself using grid to relocate the position of an element, consider whether you should return to your document and make a change to the logical order too. The nice thing about using CSS Grid Layout is that you should be able to move an item in the source to match the logical order, without needing to make big changes to your layout. This is a huge improvement over a float-based layout for example, where document source matters a lot in order to get layouts at different breakpoints. However the onus is on us as developers to remember to go back to our source and update it to maintain logical order.
trans-unit.target: 如果在设计过程中的任何时候发现自己使用网格来重新定位元素的位置，请考虑是否应该返回文档并也更改逻辑顺序。使用CSS Grid Layout的好处是，您应该能够在源中移动项目以符合逻辑顺序，而无需对布局进行大的更改。例如，这是对基于 float 的布局的巨大改进，在浮动布局中，文档源对于在不同断点处获取布局至关重要。但是，作为开发人员，我们有责任记住回到源头并对其进行更新以保持逻辑顺序。

If one filter is none, it is replaced with the filter functions list of the other one using the filter function default values, then all filter functions are interpolated according to their specific rules. If it is omitted, a “sparse” algorithm is used, where the placement algorithm only ever moves “forward” in the grid when placing items, never backtracking to fill holes. This ensures that all of the auto-placed items appear “in order”, even if this leaves holes that could have been filled by later items.

trans-unit.source: If the font does not provide a face that exactly matches the given value, then values less than 100% map to a narrower face, and values greater than or equal to 100% map to a wider face.
If the font face is not loaded, any element attempting to use it must render a fallback font face. If the font face successfully loads during this period, it is used normally.
If the font face is not loaded, any element attempting to use it must render an invisible fallback font face. If the font face successfully loads during this period, it is used normally.
If the font face is not loaded, the user agent treats it as a failed load causing normal font fallback.

If the font file includes information about a preferred position, use that value. If the font file doesn't include this information, behave as if auto was set, with the browser choosing an appropriate position.

If the font file includes information about a preferred thickness, use that value. If the font file doesn't include this information, behave as if auto was set, with the browser choosing an appropriate thickness.

If the font size is 20 pixels or higher, Firefox treats auto as optimizeLegibility. For smaller text, Firefox treats auto as optimizeSpeed. The 20-pixel threshold can be changed with the browser.display.auto_quality_min_font_size preference.

trans-unit.source: If the grid container has a definite or maximal size in the relevant axis, then the number of repetitions is the largest possible positive integer that does not cause the grid to overflow its grid container. Treating each track as its maximal track sizing function (each independant value used to define grid-template-rows or grid-template-columns), if that is definite. Otherwise, as its minimum track sizing function, and taking grid-gap into account. If any number of repetitions would overflow, then the repetition is 1. Otherwise, if the grid container has a definite minimal size in the relevant axis, the number of repetitions is the smallest possible positive integer that fulfills that minimum requirement. Otherwise, the specified track list repeats only once.

If the grid container has a definite or maximal size in the relevant axis, then the number of repetitions is the largest possible positive integer that does not cause the grid to overflow its grid container. Treating each track as its maximal track sizing function, if that is definite. Otherwise, as its minimum track sizing function, and taking grid-gap into account. If any number of repetitions would overflow, then the repetition is 1. Otherwise, if the grid container has a definite minimal size in the relevant axis, the number of repetitions is the smallest possible positive integer that fulfills that minimum requirement. Otherwise, the specified track list repeats only once.
trans-unit.target: 如果网格容器在相关轴上具有确定或最大的大小，则重复次数是最大可能的正整数，不会导致网格溢出其网格容器。如果这是确定的，则将每个轨道视为其最大轨道大小调整函数。否则，将其作为最小的轨道大小调整功能，并考虑网格间距。如果任何数量的重复将溢出，则重复为 1 。否则，如果网格容器在相关轴上具有确定的最小大小，则重复次数是满足该最小要求的可能的最小正整数。否则，指定的曲目列表仅重复一次。

If the image has no intrinsic proportion, use the specified dimension for that dimension. For the other dimension, use the image's corresponding intrinsic dimension if there is one. If there is no such intrinsic dimension, use the corresponding dimension of the mask positioning area.
trans-unit.target: 如果图像有内在比例,则使用指定的维度进行渲染,并从指定的维度和内在比例计算其他维度。如果图像没有固有比例,则使用该维度的指定维度。对于另一个维度,使用图像对应的固有维度(如果有)。如果没有这样的固有尺寸,则使用遮罩定位区域的相应尺寸。

trans-unit.source: If the image has an intrinsic ratio (that is, its width:height ratio is constant, such as 16:9, 4:3, 2.39:1, 1:1, and so forth), the rendered size preserves that ratio.
trans-unit.target: 如果图像有一个固有的比例(即它的宽:高比例是恒定的,如16:9、4:3、2.39:1、1:1等),则渲染后的尺寸会保留这个比例。

trans-unit.source: If the image has both horizontal and vertical intrinsic dimensions, it's rendered at that size.
trans-unit.target: 如果图像同时具有水平和垂直的内在尺寸,则按该尺寸渲染。

trans-unit.source: If the image has both intrinsic dimensions, it is rendered at that size. If it has no intrinsic dimensions and no intrinsic proportion, it is rendered at the size of the mask positioning area. If it has no dimensions but has a proportion, it's rendered as if contain had been specified instead. If the image has one intrinsic dimension and a proportion, it's rendered at the size determined by that one dimension and the proportion. If the image has one intrinsic dimension but no proportion, it's rendered using the intrinsic dimension and the corresponding dimension of the mask positioning area.
trans-unit.target: 如果图像具有两个固有尺寸，则以该尺寸渲染。如果没有固有尺寸且没有固有比例，则以蒙版定位区域的大小进行渲染。如果没有尺寸而是有比例，则将其渲染为 contain 已被指定。如果图像具有一个固有尺寸和比例，则以该尺寸和比例确定的尺寸进行渲染。如果图像具有一个固有尺寸但没有比例，则使用固有尺寸和蒙版定位区域的相应尺寸进行渲染。

trans-unit.source: If the image has intrinsic proportions, it's stretched to the specified dimension. The unspecified dimension is computed using the specified dimension and the intrinsic proportions.
trans-unit.target: 如果图像有固有的比例,它将被拉伸到指定的尺寸。未指定的尺寸是用指定的尺寸和固有比例计算出来的。

trans-unit.source: If the image has no dimensions or intrinsic ratio, rule 4 applies, and we use the background area's dimension to determine the value for the auto dimension.
trans-unit.target: 如果图像没有尺寸或固有比率，则规则4适用，并且我们使用背景区域的尺寸来确定 auto 尺寸的值。

trans-unit.source: If the image has no intrinsic dimensions and has no intrinsic proportions, it's rendered at the size of the background positioning area.
trans-unit.target: 如果图像没有内在尺寸,也没有内在比例,则按背景定位区域的大小渲染。

trans-unit.source: If the image has no intrinsic dimensions but has intrinsic proportions, it's rendered as if contain had been specified instead.
trans-unit.target: 如果图像没有固有尺寸而是具有固有比例，则将其渲染为好像已指定了 contain 。

trans-unit.source: If the image has no intrinsic proportions, it's stretched to the specified dimension. The unspecified dimension is computed using the image's corresponding intrinsic dimension, if there is one. If there is no such intrinsic dimension, it becomes the corresponding dimension of the background positioning area.
trans-unit.target: 如果图像没有固有比例,则将其拉伸到指定尺寸。未指定的尺寸是利用图像对应的固有尺寸(如果有的话)计算出来的。如果没有这样的固有尺寸,则成为背景定位区域的对应尺寸。

trans-unit.source: If the image has one specified dimension but no intrinsic ratio, that specified dimension is used per rule 3 if that dimension is set to auto in the CSS.
trans-unit.target: 如果图像具有一个指定的尺寸，但没有固有比率，则在CSS 中将规则3设置为 auto 时，将使用该指定的尺寸。

trans-unit.source: If the image has only one intrinsic dimension and has intrinsic proportions, it's rendered at the size corresponding to that one dimension. The other dimension is computed using the specified dimension and the intrinsic proportions.
trans-unit.target: 如果图像只有一个固有尺寸和固有比例,则以该尺寸对应的尺寸渲染。另一个维度则使用指定的维度和固有比例计算。

trans-unit.source: If the image has only one intrinsic dimension but has no intrinsic proportions, it's rendered using the specified dimension and the other dimension of the background positioning area.
trans-unit.target: 如果图像只有一个固有维度,但没有固有比例,则使用指定的维度和背景定位区域的另一个维度进行渲染。

trans-unit.source: If the image specifies a size, and the size isn't modified by constrain or cover, that specified size wins.
trans-unit.target: 如果图像指定了一个尺寸,并且该尺寸没有被constrain或cover修改,则指定的尺寸获胜。

trans-unit.source: If the intent is to create a "blanket" style that will apply to all targeted elements, then the universal selector comes in handy:
trans-unit.target: 如果打算创建一个适用于所有目标元素的 "空白 "样式,那么通用选择器就会派上用场。

trans-unit.source: If the items don’t have a size then the content's size is used as the flex-basis. This is why when we just declare display: flex on the parent to create flex items, the items all move into a row and take only as much space as they need to display their contents.
trans-unit.target: 如果项目没有大小，则将内容的大小用作伸缩基础。这就是为什么当我们只在父级上声明 display: flex 以创建flex项目时，这些项目全部移入一行并且仅占用它们显示内容所需要的空间的原因。

trans-unit.source: If the lower bound of any range is higher than the upper bound, the entire descriptor is invalid and will be ignored.
trans-unit.target: 如果任何范围的下界高于上界,整个描述符无效,并将被忽略。

trans-unit.source: If the main axis is in the block direction because flex-direction is set to column, then justify-content will distribute space between items in that dimension as long as there is space in the flex container to distribute.
trans-unit.target: 如果由于 flex-direction 设置为 column 而主轴位于块方向，那么只要flex容器中有空间可分配，则 justify-content 将在该维度中的项目之间分配空间。

trans-unit.source: If the output device is a printer, and to save ink, dark or extremely dense background images might be removed.
trans-unit.target: 如果输出设备是打印机,为了节省墨水,可能会删除深色或密度极高的背景图像。

trans-unit.source: If the property has a value different than none, a stacking context will be created. In that case, the element will act as a containing block for any position: fixed; or position: absolute; elements that it contains.
If the property has a value different than none, a stacking context will be created. In that case, the object will act as a containing block for any position: fixed elements that it contains.
trans-unit.target: 如果该属性的值不同于 none ，则将创建一个堆栈上下文。在这种情况下，该对象将充当任何 position: fixed 的包含块：它包含的固定元素。

trans-unit.source: If the second and third values are missing they are given a value of auto.
trans-unit.target: 如果缺少第二个和第三个值,它们的值为自动。

trans-unit.source: If the size of the item overflows the alignment container, the item is instead aligned as if the alignment mode were start.
trans-unit.target: 如果项目的大小溢出对齐容器，则将对齐该项目，就像对齐模式为 start 一样。

trans-unit.source: If the spanning element is inside another element which has margins, padding and a border or a background color, it is possible to end up with the top of the box appearing above the spanner and the rest displaying below, as shown in the next example. For this reason, some care should be taken when deciding to make an element a spanner and ensure this scenario is accounted for.
trans-unit.target: 如果跨接元素在另一个有页边距、padding和边框或背景色的元素里面,就有可能最终导致框的顶部出现在扳手的上方,而其他部分显示在下方,如下一个例子所示。出于这个原因,在决定将一个元素变成扳手时,应该小心翼翼,并确保考虑到这种情况。

trans-unit.source: If the specified decoration has a specific semantic meaning, like a line-through line meaning that some text has been deleted, authors are encouraged to denote this meaning using an HTML tag, like <del> or <s>. As browsers can disable styling in some cases, the semantic meaning won't disappear in such a situation.
trans-unit.target: 如果指定的修饰具有特定的语义含义，例如直通行表示某些文本已被删除，则鼓励作者使用HTML标记（例如 <del> 或 <s> )来表示此含义。由于在某些情况下浏览器可以禁用样式，因此语义含义不会消失。

trans-unit.source: If the specified fallback style is also unable to construct a representation, then its fallback style will be used. If a valid fallback style is not specified, it defaults to decimal.
If the specified size defines both the width and the height, these values are used as the concrete object size.
trans-unit.target: 如果指定的大小同时定义了width和height，则这些值将用作具体对象的大小。

trans-unit.source: If the specified size defines neither the width nor the height, the concrete object size is calculated so that it matches the intrinsic aspect ratio of the image but without exceeding the default object size in any dimension. If the image has no intrinsic aspect ratio, the intrinsic aspect ratio of the object it applies to is used; if this object has none, the missing width or height are taken from the default object size.
trans-unit.target: 如果指定的尺寸未定义width或height，则将计算具体的对象尺寸，以使其与图像的固有长宽比匹配，但不超出任何尺寸的默认对象尺寸。如果图像没有固有长宽比，则使用它应用于对象的固有长宽比；如果该对象没有对象，则缺少的宽度或高度将从默认对象大小中获取。

trans-unit.source: If the specified size defines only the width or only the height, the missing value is determined using the intrinsic ratio, if there is any, the intrinsic dimensions if the specified value matches, or the default object size for that missing value.
trans-unit.target: 如果指定的大小仅定义宽度或高度，则使用固有比率（如果有）确定缺失值，如果指定值匹配，则确定固有尺寸，或者使用该缺失值的默认对象大小。

trans-unit.source: If the table layout were auto, the table would grow to accomodate its contents, despite the specified width.
trans-unit.target: 如果表格布局是 auto ，则尽管指定了 width ，表格也会增长以容纳其内容。

trans-unit.source: If the target weight given is between 400 and 500 inclusive:
trans-unit.target: 如果给定的目标体重在 400 到 500 之间（含）：

trans-unit.source: If the third value is missing it is equal to the second.
trans-unit.target: 如果缺少第三个值,则等于第二个值。

trans-unit.source: If the three menu levels partially overlap, then managing stacking could become a problem.
If the user agent is using Maemo with the original theme, this is 1. If it's using the newer Fremantle theme, this is 0.
trans-unit.target: 如果用户代理使用的是原主题的Maemo,则为1,如果使用的是较新的Fremantle主题,则为0。

trans-unit.source: If the user has configured their device to use the "Graphite" appearance on Mac OS X, this is 1. If the user is using the standard blue appearance, or is not on Mac OS X, this is 0.
trans-unit.target: 如果用户在Mac OS X上将设备配置为使用 "Graphite "外观,则该值为1;如果用户使用标准的蓝色外观,或者不在Mac OS X上,则该值为0。

trans-unit.source: If the user is using Windows Glass theme, this is 1; otherwise it's 0. Note that this only exists for Windows 7 and earlier.
trans-unit.target: 如果用户使用的是Windows Glass主题,则该值为1,否则为0.请注意,该值只存在于Windows 7及更早版本。

trans-unit.source: If the user is using Windows unthemed (in classic mode instead of using uxtheme), this is 1. Otherwise it's 0.
trans-unit.target: 如果用户使用的是Windows非主题(在经典模式下,而不是使用uxtheme),则为1,否则为0。

trans-unit.source: If the user is using Windows with the DWM compositor, this is 1. Otherwise it's 0.
trans-unit.target: 如果用户使用Windows与DWM合成器,则为1,否则为0。

trans-unit.source: If the user is using one of the default Windows themes—Luna, Royale, Zune, or Aero (including Vista Basic, Vista Advanced, and Aero Glass)—this is 1. Otherwise it's 0.
trans-unit.target: 如果用户使用默认Windows主题之一-Luna，Royale，Zune或Aero（包括Vista Basic，Vista Advanced和Aero Glass），则为1。否则为0。

trans-unit.source: If the value is translucent, the computed value will be the rgba() corresponding one. If it isn't, it will be the rgb() corresponding one. The transparent keyword maps to rgba(0,0,0,0).
trans-unit.target: 如果该值是半透明的，则计算的值将是对应的 rgba() 。如果不是，它将是对应的 rgb() 。所述 transparent 关键字映射到 rgba(0,0,0,0) 。

trans-unit.source: If the value of speak-as is specified as auto, then the effective value of speak-as will be determined based on the value of the system descriptor:
trans-unit.target: 如果价值 speak-as 被指定为 auto ，然后有效值 speak-as 将根据价值来确定 system 描述：

trans-unit.source: If the value of system is alphabetic, the effective value of speak-as will be spell-out.
trans-unit.target: 如果价值 system 是 alphabetic ，有效值 speak-as 会 spell-out 。

trans-unit.source: If the value of this property is not set in a border-radius shorthand property that is applied to the element after the border-bottom-left-radius CSS property, the value of this property is then reset to its initial value by the shorthand property.
trans-unit.target: 如果此属性的值未在 border-bottom-left-radius CSS属性之后应用于元素的 border-radius 速记属性中设置，则该属性的值将由shorthand属性重置为其初始值。

trans-unit.source: If the value of this property is not set in a border-radius shorthand property that is applied to the element after the border-bottom-right-radius CSS property, the value of this property is then reset to its initial value by the shorthand property.
trans-unit.target: 如果没有在 border-bottom-right-radius CSS属性之后应用于元素的 border-radius 速记属性中设置此属性的值，则该属性的值将由shorthand属性重置为其初始值。

trans-unit.source: If the value of this property is not set in a border-radius shorthand property that is applied to the element after the border-top-left-radius CSS property, the value of this property is then reset to its initial value by the shorthand property.
trans-unit.target: 如果此属性的值未在 border-top-left-radius CSS属性之后应用于元素的 border-radius 速记属性中设置，则该属性的值将由shorthand属性重置为其初始值。

trans-unit.source: If the value of this property is not set in a border-radius shorthand property that is applied to the element after the border-top-radius-radius CSS property, the value of this property is then reset to its initial value by the shorthand property.
trans-unit.target: 如果没有在 border-top-radius-radius CSS属性之后应用于元素的 border-radius 速记属性中设置此属性的值，则该属性的值将由shorthand属性重置为其初始值。

trans-unit.source: If the viewport is smaller than the size of the document then the user agent needs to offer a way to scroll to the parts of the document that are not displayed. We most often see this as scrolling in the block dimension — vertically in a horizontal, top-to-bottom language. However, you might design something that requires scrolling in the inline dimension too.

If the writing mode is vertically oriented, the value of block-size relates to the width of the element; otherwise, it relates to the height of the element. A related property is inline-size, which defines the other dimension of the element.
trans-unit.target: 如果写入模式为垂直方向，则 block-size 的值与元素的宽度有关；否则，它与元素的高度有关。一个相关的属性是 inline-size ，它定义元素的另一个尺寸。

trans-unit.source: If the writing mode is vertically oriented, the value of inline-size relates to the height of the element; otherwise, it relates to the width of the element. A related property is block-size, which defines the other dimension of the element.
trans-unit.target: 如果书写模式是垂直方向，则 inline-size 的值与元素的高度有关；否则，它与元素的宽度有关。一个相关的属性是 block-size ，它定义元素的其他尺寸。

trans-unit.source: If the writing mode is vertically oriented, the value of max-inline-size relates to the maximal height of the element; otherwise, it relates to the maximal width of the element. A related property is max-block-size, which defines the other dimension of the element.

If the writing mode is vertically oriented, the value of min-block-size relates to the minimum width of the element; otherwise, it relates to the minimum height of the element. A related property is min-inline-size, which defines the other dimension of the element.
trans-unit.target: 如果写入模式是垂直方向，则 min-block-size 的值与元素的最小宽度有关；否则，它与元素的最小高度有关。一个相关的属性是 min-inline-size ，它定义元素的另一个尺寸。

trans-unit.source: If the writing mode is vertically oriented, the value of min-inline-size relates to the minimum height of the element; otherwise, it relates to the minimum width of the element. A related property is min-block-size, which defines the other dimension of the element.
trans-unit.target: 如果书写模式是垂直方向，则 min-inline-size 的值与元素的最小高度有关；否则，它与元素的最小宽度有关。一个相关的属性是 min-block-size ，它定义元素的其他尺寸。

trans-unit.source: If there are fewer values than tracks, the last value is used for all remaining tracks. If there are more values than tracks, any additional values are ignored.
If there are several block boxes, without inline content in-between, the anonymous block boxes are created before, and after the set of boxes.
trans-unit.target: 如果有几个区块框,中间没有内嵌内容,则在前面创建匿名区块框,在后面创建一组框。

trans-unit.source: If there is a named line with the name '<custom-ident>-end', it contributes the first such line to the grid item’s placement.
trans-unit.target: 如果有一个名为“ <custom-ident> -end”的命名行，则它将第一行添加到网格项目的位置。

trans-unit.source: If there is a named line with the name '<custom-ident>-start', it contributes the first such line to the grid item’s placement.
trans-unit.target: 如果有一个名为“ <custom-ident> -start”的命名行，则它将第一行添加到网格项目的位置。

trans-unit.source: If there is a named line with the name '<custom-ident>-start'/'<custom-ident>-end', it contributes the first such line to the grid item’s placement.
trans-unit.target: 如果有一个名为“ <custom-ident>-开始” /“ <custom-ident>-结束”的命名行，则它将第一行添加到网格项的位置。

trans-unit.source: If there is a named line with the name '<custom-ident>-start'/'<custom-ident>-end', it contributes the first such line to the grid item’s placement.
trans-unit.target: 如果有一个名为' <custom-ident>-start '/' <custom-ident>-end ' 的命名行，则它将第一行添加到网格项目的位置。

trans-unit.source: If there is a named line with the name <custom-ident>-start, it contributes the first such line to the grid item’s placement.
If there is no border, padding, inline content, height, or min-height to separate a block's margin-top from its margin-bottom, then its top and bottom margins collapse.
trans-unit.target: 如果没有边框，内边距，内联内容， height 或 min-height 来将块的页 margin-top 与页 margin-bottom 分开，则其顶部和底部页边距将崩溃。

trans-unit.source: If there is no border, padding, inline content, height, or min-height to separate a block's margin-top from its margin-bottom, then its top and bottom margins collapse.
trans-unit.target: 如果没有边框，内边距，内联内容， height 或 min-height 来将块的页 margin-top 与页 margin-bottom 分开，则其顶部和底部页边距将崩溃。

trans-unit.source: If there is no border, padding, inline part, block formatting context created, or clearance to separate the margin-top of a block from the margin-top of its first child block; or no border, padding, inline content, height, min-height, or max-height to separate the margin-bottom of a block from the margin-bottom of its last child, then those margins collapse. The collapsed margin ends up outside the parent.
trans-unit.target: 如果没有边界，填充，内联部分，块格式化上下文创建，或者间隙来分隔 margin-top 从一个块的 margin-top 其第一个子块的;或没有边框，内边距，内联内容， height ， min-height 或 max-height 来将块的 margin-bottom 与最后一个子元素的 margin-bottom 分开，则这些边距会崩溃。折叠的边距最终在父级之外。

trans-unit.source: If there is no border, padding, inline part, block formatting context created, or clearance to separate the margin-top of a block from the margin-top of one or more of its descendant blocks; or no border, padding, inline content, height, min-height, or max-height to separate the margin-bottom of a block from the margin-bottom of one or more of its descendant blocks, then those margins collapse. The collapsed margin ends up outside the parent.

If there is no border, padding, inline part, block formatting context created, or clearance to separate the margin-top of a block from the margin-top of its first child block; or no border, padding, inline content, height, min-height, or max-height to separate the margin-bottom of a block from the margin-bottom of its last child, then those margins collapse. The collapsed margin ends up outside the parent.
trans-unit.target: 如果没有边界，填充，内联部分，块格式化上下文创建，或者间隙来分隔 margin-top 从一个块的 margin-top 其第一个子块的;或没有边框，内边距，内联内容， height ， min-height 或 max-height 来将块的 margin-bottom 与最后一个子元素的 margin-bottom 分开，则这些边距会崩溃。折叠的边距最终在父级之外。

trans-unit.source: If there is no border, padding, inline part, block formatting context created, or clearance to separate the margin-top of a block from the margin-top of one or more of its descendant blocks; or no border, padding, inline content, height, min-height, or max-height to separate the margin-bottom of a block from the margin-bottom of one or more of its descendant blocks, then those margins collapse. The collapsed margin ends up outside the parent.

If there isn't already a style sheet, a new <style> element is created, and its content is set to the value of keyframes. Then the new <style> element is inserted into the document's <head>, thereby adding the new style sheet to the document.
trans-unit.target: 如果还没有样式表，则会创建一个新的 <style> 元素，并将其内容设置为关键帧的值。然后，将新的 <style> 元素插入文档的 <head> 中，从而将新的样式表添加到文档中。

trans-unit.source: If this causes a problem for your layout it may require a rethinking of the structure, for example putting each row into a separate flex container in order that they can’t shift rows.
trans-unit.target: 如果这对您的布局造成问题，则可能需要重新考虑结构，例如，将每一行放入单独的flex容器中，以使它们不能移动行。

trans-unit.source: If this property's value is greater than the element's border-width, the border image will extend beyond the padding (and/or content) edge.
trans-unit.target: 如果此属性的值大于元素的 border-width ，则边框图像将超出填充（和/或内容）边缘。

trans-unit.source: If three values are set, the first one applies to the top-Left corner, the second one to the top-right and bottom-left corners and the third one to the bottom-right corner.
trans-unit.target: 如果设置三个值,第一个适用于左上角,第二个适用于右上角和左下角,第三个适用于右下角。

trans-unit.source: If two <grid-line> values are specified, the grid-row-start longhand is set to the value before the slash, and the grid-row-end longhand is set to the value after the slash.
trans-unit.target: 如果指定了两个<grid-line>值，则将 grid-row-start 的正手设置为斜线之前的值，并将 grid-row-end 的正手设置为斜线之后的值。

trans-unit.source: If two <grid-line> values are given they are separated by "/". The grid-column-start longhand is set to the value before the slash, and the grid-column-end longhand is set to the value after the slash.

trans-unit.source: If two or more color stops are at the same location, the transition will be a hard line between the first and last colors declared at that location.

trans-unit.source: If we add writing-mode: vertical-lr to the grid container, we can see that the block and inline Axis are now running in a different direction. The block or column axis now runs across the page from left to right, Inline runs down the page, creating rows from top to bottom.

trans-unit.source: If you are familiar with flexbox then you will already have encountered the way in which flex items can be properly aligned inside the flex container. These alignment properties that we first met in the flexbox specification have been moved into a new specification called Box Alignment Level 3. This specification has details for how alignment should work in all of the different layout methods.
trans-unit.target: 如果您熟悉flexbox，那么您将已经遇到了可以在flex容器内正确对齐flex项的方法。我们在flexbox规范中首次遇到的这些对齐属性已被移到称为Box Alignment Level 3的新规范中。该规范详细说明了对齐方式在所有不同的布局方法中应如何工作。

trans-unit.source: If you are using display: table for your legacy layout, an item set to display: table-cell generates anonymous boxes. Therefore, if you use display: table-cell without any parent element set to display-table, an anonymous table wrapper is created around any adjacent cells, just as if you had wrapped them in a div or other element set to display: table. If you have an item set to display: table-cell, and then in a feature query change the parent to display: grid, this anonymous box creation will not happen. This means you can overwrite display: table based layouts, without having additional anonymous boxes.
trans-unit.target: 如果将 display: table 用于旧版布局，则设置为 display: table-cell 的项目将生成匿名框。因此，如果您使用 display: table-cell 而不将任何父元素设置为 display-table ，则会在任何相邻单元格周围创建一个匿名表包装器，就像您将它们包装在div或其他设置为 display: table 元素中一样。如果您将项目设置为 display: table-cell ，然后在功能查询中将父项更改为 display: grid ，则不会发生此匿名框的创建。这意味着您可以覆盖 display: table 基于表格的布局，而无需其他匿名框。

trans-unit.source: If you are using a reverse value, or otherwise reordering your items, you should consider whether you actually need to change the logical order in the source. The specification continues with a warning not to use reordering to fix issues in your source:
trans-unit.target: 如果你正在使用一个反向值,或者以其他方式重新排序你的项目,你应该考虑你是否真的需要改变源中的逻辑顺序。该规范继续警告不要使用重新排序来解决你的源中的问题。

trans-unit.source: If you are using flexbox and find yourself disabling some of the flexibility, you probably need to use CSS Grid Layout. An example would be if you are setting a percentage width on a flex item to make it line up with other items in a row above. In that case, a grid is likely to be a better choice.
trans-unit.target: 如果你正在使用flexbox,并发现自己禁用了一些灵活性,你可能需要使用CSS Grid Layout。一个例子是,如果你正在设置一个弹性项目的百分比宽度,使其与上面一行的其他项目对齐。在这种情况下,网格可能是一个更好的选择。

trans-unit.source: If you change flex-direction to one of the reverse values, then they will lay themselves out from the end axis and in the reverse order to the way words are written in the language of your document. flex-start will then change to the end of that axis — so to the location where your lines would wrap if working in rows, or at the end of your last paragraph of text in the block direction.
trans-unit.target: 如果将flex-direction更改为反向值之一，则它们将沿端轴布局，并以与文档语言书写单词的方式相反的顺序排列。然后， flex-start 将更改为该轴的末尾-因此，如果行中行，则行将换行的位置，也将变为块方向上文本的最后一段的末尾。

trans-unit.source: If you change the value of direction to rtl you will see that the alignment stays to the right for the first block, but goes to the logical end on the left in the second.
trans-unit.target: 如果将 direction 的值更改为 rtl ,您将看到对齐方式在第一个块的右侧保留，但在第二个块的左侧逻辑对齐。

trans-unit.source: If you have a gap, column-gap, or row-gap specified on the parent, this will be passed into the subgrid, so it will have the same spacing between tracks as the parent. If you have a situation where your grid tracks use an area that is smaller than the grid container, then you can align the grid tracks themselves, inside that container. Once again, this operates on the block and inline axes, with align-content aligning tracks on the block axis, and justify-content performing alignment on the inline axis. trans-unit.source: If you have already used the old implementation as a fallback, or feel you want to support users of old Firefox (or -webkit prefixed Safari), then you can continue to use the old specification as outlined in the example below.

If you have been working with one of the many frameworks or grid systems you may be accustomed to laying out your site on a 12- or 16-column flexible grid. We can create this type of system using CSS Grid Layout. As a simple example, I am creating a 12-column flexible grid that has 12 1fr-unit column tracks, they all have a start line named col-start. This means that we will have twelve grid lines named col-start.

trans-unit.source: If you have only used the old Firefox implementation of the specification, with the properties that are detailed in Scroll Snap Points, you should update your code to use the new specification. This will ensure your scroll snapping works in all browsers which implement the specification, including Firefox. If you do not do this your scroll snapping will no longer work in Firefox 68 and up.

If you have read the article Basic Concepts of Flexbox, then you will have already had an introduction to the properties. Here we will explore them in depth in order that you can fully understand what the browser is doing when you use them.

If you have set values using font-variation-settings and want to change one of those values, you must redeclare all of them (in the same way as when you set OpenType font features using font-feature-settings). You can work around this limitation by using CSS Custom Properties (CSS variables) for the individual values, and simply modifying the value of an individual custom property. Example code follows at the end of the guide.
trans-unit.target: 如果您使用 font-variation-settings 设置了值，并且想要更改这些值之一，则必须重新声明所有值（与使用 font-feature-settings 设置OpenType字体功能时相同）。您可以通过为单个值使用CSS定制属性（CSS变量），并简单地修改单个定制属性的值来解决此限制。本指南末尾有示例代码。

trans-unit.source: If you have small amounts of content and are trying to control breaks in a number of ways or on several elements, your content needs to break somewhere, so you may not always get the result you intended. To some extent your use of fragmentation is always a suggestion to the browser, to control breaks in this way if it is possible.
trans-unit.target: 如果你有少量的内容,并且试图以多种方式或在几个元素上控制断点,你的内容需要在某个地方断点,所以你可能不一定能得到你想要的结果。在某种程度上,你使用碎片化总是对浏览器的一种建议,如果可能的话,用这种方式来控制断点。

trans-unit.source: If you have used a track list then you can use the span keyword not just to span a number of lines but also to span a number of lines of a certain name.
trans-unit.target: 如果使用了曲目列表，则可以使用 span 关键字，不仅可以跨越多个行，还可以跨越一个特定名称的行。

trans-unit.source: If you have worked through these initial guides you now should be in a position to create grid layouts using line-based placement or named areas. Take some time to build some common layout patterns using grid, while there are lots of new terms to learn, the syntax is relatively straightforward. As you develop examples, you are likely to come up with some questions and use cases for things we haven't covered yet. In the rest of these guides we will be looking at some more of the detail included in the specification – in order that you can begin to create advanced layouts with it.
trans-unit.target: 如果您已经完成了这些初始指南，则现在应该可以使用基于行的放置或命名区域来创建网格布局。花一些时间使用网格构建一些常见的布局模式，尽管有很多新的术语需要学习，但语法相对简单。在开发示例时，您可能会针对我们尚未涉及的问题提出一些问题和用例。在这些指南的其余部分中，我们将着眼于规范中包含的更多细节，以便您可以开始使用它来创建高级布局。

trans-unit.source: If you hover or tab onto the grid container however, it is given a justify-items value of center, which causes the grid items to span only as wide as their content width, and align in the center of their cells.

If you include an SVG file in your HTML, the viewport of the SVG is the initial containing block, or the width and height of the SVG container. Using the @media query in your SVG's CSS is relative to that container, not the browser.
trans-unit.target: 如果在HTML中包含SVG文件，则SVG的视口是初始包含块，或者是SVG容器的宽度和高度。在SVG的CSS中使用 @media 查询是相对于该容器而不是浏览器的。

trans-unit.source: If you include an SVG file in your HTML, the viewport of the SVG is the initial containing block, or the width and height of the SVG container. Using the @media query in your SVG's CSS is relative to that container, not the browser.
trans-unit.target: 如果在HTML中包含SVG文件，则SVG的视口是初始包含块，或者是SVG容器的宽度和高度。在SVG的CSS中使用 @media 查询是相对于该容器而不是浏览器的。

trans-unit.source: If you initially learned Flexbox then you may consider these properties to be part of the Flexbox specification, and some of the properties are indeed listed in Level 1 of Flexbox. However the specification notes that the Box Alignment specification should be referred to as it may add additional capabilities over what is currently in Flexbox.
trans-unit.target: 如果您最初学习过Flexbox，则可以将这些属性视为Flexbox规范的一部分，并且某些属性确实列在Flexbox的1级中。但是，该规范指出应该引用Box Alignment规范，因为它可能会增加Flexbox当前的功能。

trans-unit.source: If you inspect this in the Firefox Grid Inspector you can see how the line of the grid is in the correct place down the center of the gap, so when we set the gap to 0, it acts in a similar way to applying a negative margin to an element, giving the space from the gap back to the item.

If you need flex items to line up in the cross axis, controlling the width in this way will achieve that. In most cases however, adding widths to flex items in this way demonstrates that you would probably be better served by switching to grid layout for that component.
trans-unit.target: 如果你需要flex项在横轴上排成一排,用这种方式控制宽度就可以实现。但在大多数情况下,以这种方式为flex项添加宽度,表明你可能会更好地对该组件切换到网格布局。

trans-unit.source: If you need to autoplace items, and do not know how many items you will have, take care when creating a subgrid, as it will prevent additional rows being created to hold those items.

If you need to be aware of changes to the evaluated result of the query on an ongoing basis, it's more efficient to register a listener than to poll the query's result. To do this, call the addListener() method on the MediaQueryList object, with a callback function to invoke when the media query status changes (e.g., the media query test goes from true to false):
trans-unit.target: 如果您需要不断了解查询评估结果的变化，则注册侦听器比轮询查询结果更有效。为此，请在 MediaQueryList 对象上调用 addListener() 方法，并使用回调函数在媒体查询状态更改时调用（例如，媒体查询测试从 true 变为 false ）：

trans-unit.source: If you need to test whether scroll anchoring is available in a browser, use Feature Queries to test support for the overflow-anchor property.

If you place something outside of the defined grid—or due to the amount of content, more grid tracks are needed—then the grid creates rows and columns in the implicit grid. These tracks will be auto-sized by default, resulting in their size being based on the content that is inside them.
trans-unit.target: 如果将某些内容放置在已定义的网格之外（或者由于内容量，则需要更多的网格轨迹），则该网格会在隐式网格中创建行和列。默认情况下，这些轨道将自动调整大小，从而导致其大小基于其内部内容。

trans-unit.source: If you reference an SVG image in a webpage (such as with the <img> element or as a background image), the SVG image can coordinate with the embedding element (its context) to have the image adopt property values set on the embedding element. To do this the embedding element needs to list the properties that are to be made available to the image by listing them as values of the -moz-context-properties property, and the image needs to opt in to using those properties by using values such as the context-fill value.
trans-unit.target: 如果您在网页中引用SVG图像（例如，使用 <img> 元素或作为背景图像），则SVG图像可以与嵌入元素（其上下文）进行协调，以使图像采用在嵌入元素上设置的属性值。为此，embedding元素需要通过将它们列出为 -moz-context-properties 属性的值来列出要对图像可用的属性，并且图像需要通过使用诸如此类的值来选择使用这些属性。作为 context-fill 值。

trans-unit.source: If you reorder things visually using grid layout, this will not change how the items are ordered if the content is being read out by a screen reader, or other text to speech user agent. In addition, the reordering will not change tab order. This means that someone navigating using the keyboard could be tabbing through links on your site and suddenly find themselves jumping from the top to the bottom of the document due to a reordered item being next in line.
trans-unit.target: 如果您使用网格布局在视觉上重新排序,如果内容是由屏幕阅读器或其他文本到语音的用户代理读出,这将不会改变项目的排序方式。此外,重新排序不会改变标签顺序。这意味着,使用键盘导航的人可能会在你的网站上通过链接进行制表,并突然发现自己从文档的顶部跳到了底部,因为一个重新排序的项目是下一个。

trans-unit.source: If you repeating syntax puts two lines next to each other then they will be merged, and create the same result as giving a line multiple names in a non-repeating track definition. The following definition, creates four 1fr tracks, which each have a start and end line.
trans-unit.target: 如果重复语法将两行相邻放置，则它们将被合并，并产生与在非重复轨道定义中给行多个名称相同的结果。以下定义创建了四个 1fr 音轨，每个音轨都有一个起始行和一个结束行。

trans-unit.source: If you set justify-content: space-between on the flex container, the available space is now shared out and placed between the items.
trans-unit.target: 如果在flex容器上设置 justify-content: space-between ，则现在将可用空间共享并放置在项目之间。

trans-unit.source: If you set an alignment that cannot be fulfilled, then the fallback alignment will come into play and deal with the available space. This fallback alignment is specified individually for each layout method and detailed on the page for that method.
trans-unit.target: 如果您设置的对齐方式无法实现，则后备对齐方式将发挥作用并处理可用空间。此后备对齐方式是为每种布局方法分别指定的，并在该方法的页面上进行了详细说明。

trans-unit.source: If you set an item to display:contents the box it would normally create disappears, and the boxes of the child elements appear as if they have risen up a level. This means that children of a grid item can become grid items. Sound odd? Here is a simple example. In the following markup, I have a grid and the first item on the grid is set to span all three column tracks. It contains three nested items. As these items are not direct children, they don’t become part of the grid layout and so display using regular block layout.
trans-unit.target: 如果将项目设置为 display: contents ，通常会创建的框会消失，子元素的框看起来好像已经升起了一层。这意味着网格项目的子代可以成为网格项目。听起来很奇怪？这是一个简单的例子。在下面的标记中，我有一个网格，并且网格上的第一项设置为跨越所有三个列轨道。它包含三个嵌套项目。由于这些项目不是直接子项，因此它们不会成为网格布局的一部分，因此使用常规块布局进行显示。

trans-unit.source: If you set the value subgrid on grid-template-columns, grid-template-rows or both, instead of creating a new track listing the nested grid uses the tracks defined on the parent.
If you specify unsafe then the alignment will be honoured even if it would cause such data loss.
trans-unit.target: 如果指定 unsafe 则即使会导致这种数据丢失，也将遵循对齐方式。

trans-unit.source: If you specify a shorthand property (e.g., background), all of its longhand sub-properties that can be animated will be.
trans-unit.target: 如果您指定了速记属性（例如 background ），则其所有可以动画化的速记子属性都将是。

trans-unit.source: If you specify both properties on a multicol container then column-count will act as a maximum number of columns. Therefore the behaviour as described for column-width will happen, until the number of columns in column-count is reached. After this point no more columns will be drawn, and the extra space is distributed evenly between the existing columns, even if there is enough room for more columns of the specified column-width size.
trans-unit.target: 如果在multicol容器上同时指定了两个属性，则 column-count 将充当最大列数。因此，将发生针对列宽描述的行为，直到达到column-count中的列数。此后，将不再绘制更多列，并且即使有足够的空间容纳指定 column-width 大小的更多列，现有列之间的剩余空间也会平均分配。

trans-unit.source: If you specify more values than tracks the additional values are ignored. If there are more tracks than values any additional tracks will use the last specified value.
If you take a look at this layout in the Firefox Grid Highlighter you can see how the column lines are shown, and how our items are placed against these lines.
trans-unit.target: 如果你在Firefox Grid Highlighter中看一下这个布局,你可以看到列线是如何显示的,以及我们的项目是如何靠着这些线放置的。

trans-unit.source: If you then declare display: flex on the parent item, these anonymous boxes do not get created and so your item remains a direct child and can become a flex item — losing any of the table display features.
trans-unit.target: 如果随后在父项目上声明 display: flex ，则不会创建这些匿名框，因此您的项目仍是直接子项，可以成为flex项目-失去任何表显示功能。

trans-unit.source: If you turn on contain: size you need to also specify the size of the element you have applied this to. It will end up being zero-sized in most cases, if you don't manually give it a size.

If you use background-size to specify fixed lengths for both dimensions, those lengths are always used, per rule 1 above. In other words, the image will always get stretched to the dimensions you specify, regardless of whether or not the source image has specified its dimensions and/or aspect ratio.
trans-unit.target: 如果您使用 background-size 为两个尺寸指定固定长度，则始终按照上述规则1使用这些长度。换句话说，无论源图像是否已指定其尺寸和/或纵横比，图像都将始终拉伸到您指定的尺寸。

trans-unit.source: If you use display: table-cell on an item in your HTML it takes on the styling of an HTML table cell. CSS creates anonymous boxes to represent these items so that you do not need to wrap each item in a wrapper to represent the HTML table row, and a second one to represent the table element itself, You can’t see or style these anonymous boxes; they are there purely to fix up the tree.
trans-unit.target: 如果在HTML中的项目上使用 display: table-cell ，它将采用HTML表格单元格的样式。CSS创建了匿名框来表示这些项目，因此您无需将每个项目都用包装器包装来表示HTML表格行，而用第二个包装器来表示表格元素本身，则无法看到或设置这些匿名框的样式。他们纯粹是在那里修理树。

trans-unit.source: If you use a <gradient> as the background and specify a background-size to go with it, it's best not to specify a size that uses a single auto component, or is specified using only a width value (for example, background-size: 50%). Rendering of <gradient>s in such cases changed in Firefox 8, and at present is generally inconsistent across browsers, which do not all implement rendering in full accordance with the CSS3 background-size specification and with the CSS3 Image Values gradient specification.
trans-unit.target: 如果将 <gradient> 用作背景并指定 background-size ，则最好不要指定使用单个 auto 组件的尺寸，或仅使用宽度值指定的尺寸（例如 background-size: 50% ）。在这种情况下， <gradient> 的呈现在Firefox 8中发生了变化，并且当前在浏览器之间通常是不一致的，浏览器并不完全按照CSS3 background-size 规范和CSS3 Image Values梯度规范来实现呈现。

trans-unit.source: If you use a sibling selector such as :visited + span, the adjacent element (span in this example) will be styled as if the link were unvisited.
trans-unit.target: 如果使用诸如 :visited + span 类的同级选择器，则将对相邻元素（在本示例中为 span ）进行样式设置，就像未访问链接一样。

trans-unit.source: If you use absolute positioning within a grid area, then you will again be using physical offsets to push the item around inside the grid area. The key thing is to be aware of, is the tension between physical and logical properties and values. For example, be aware that you may need to make changes to your CSS to cope with a switch from ltr to rtl.
trans-unit.target: 如果您在网格区域内使用绝对定位，那么您将再次使用物理偏移量将项目推到网格区域内。要意识到的关键是物理和逻辑属性与值之间的张力。例如，请注意，您可能需要更改CSS才能应对从 ltr 到 rtl 的切换。

trans-unit.source: If you want apply multiple transformations to an element, be careful about the order in which you specify your transformations. For example, if you rotate before translating, the translation will be along the new axis of rotation!

trans-unit.source: If you want flexbox to completely ignore the size of the item when doing space distribution then set flex-basis to 0. This essentially tells flexbox that all the space is up for grabs, and to share it out in proportion. We will see examples of this as we move on to look at flex-grow.
trans-unit.target: 如果您希望flexbox在进行空间分配时完全忽略项目的大小，请将 flex-basis 设置为 0 。这从本质上告诉flexbox，所有空间都可以争夺，并按比例共享。在继续研究 flex-grow 时,我们将看到这样的示例。

trans-unit.source: If you want layout in two dimensions then you probably want Grid Layout. The following live sample uses CSS Grid Layout to create a layout that has as many columns of at least 160 pixels as will fit, distributing the extra space between all columns. However, in this case the items stay in their grid and don’t stretch out when there are fewer of them on the final row.

trans-unit.target: 如果你想更多地控制它的方向,你可以给梯度一个特定的角度。

If you want to give all of the lines in your grid a unique name then you will need to write out the track definition long-hand rather than using the repeat syntax, as you need to add the name in square brackets while defining the tracks. If you do use the repeat syntax you will end up with multiple lines that have the same name, however this can be very useful too.
trans-unit.target: 如果你想给网格中的所有线条取一个独特的名字,那么你需要用长手写出轨迹定义,而不是使用重复语法,因为你需要在定义轨迹时把名字加在方括号里。如果你真的使用重复语法,你最终会有多行相同的名称,不过这也是非常有用的。

However, these properties shouldn't cause any problems to non-supporting browsers due to the way that browsers simply ignore CSS that they do not understand.

If your JavaScript is listening for scroll wheel Document Object Model (DOM) events, the events that occur when the user scrolls vertically will always be vertical scroll events, not horizontal scroll events. Similarly, the events that occur when the user scrolls horizontally will always be horizontal scroll events. This property enables you to change this behavior for vertical scroll events. By setting the -ms-scroll-translation property to vertical-to-horizontal, you are specifying that vertical scroll events should be interpreted as their corresponding horizontal scroll events.
trans-unit.target: 如果您的JavaScript正在侦听滚轮文档对象模型（DOM）事件，则用户垂直滚动时发生的事件将始终是垂直滚动事件，而不是水平滚动事件。同样，当用户水平滚动时发生的事件将始终是水平滚动事件。此属性使您可以更改垂直滚动事件的此行为。通过将 -ms-scroll-translation 属性设置为 vertical-to-horizontal ，您可以指定将垂直滚动事件解释为其相应的水平滚动事件。
